remarks:
A more general version of ~ cbvreuv that has no distinct variable restrictions.  Changes bound variables using implicit substitution. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 13-Jul-2011.) 

---

 A more general version of ~ cbvreuv that has no distinct variable rextrictions.  Changes bound variables using implicit substitution. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 13-Jul-2011.)
statement:
cbvralcsf.1 $e |- F/_ y A $.
cbvralcsf.2 $e |- F/_ x B $.
cbvralcsf.3 $e |- F/ y ph $.
cbvralcsf.4 $e |- F/ x ps $.
cbvralcsf.5 $e |- ( x = y -> A = B ) $.
cbvralcsf.6 $e |- ( x = y -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
cbvreucsf $p |- ( E! x e. A ph <-> E! y e. B ps ) $.
